website_summaries.verdict: If budget is a concern, this generator is a decent compromise.
pros: About half the weight of larger generators
Equipped with a large-capacity tank, steel cradle, three covered outlets, and low oil detection
Also comes with a handle kit, a wheel kit, and a quick-start guide
cons: At 3,250 running watts, you will have to pick and choose the most essential appliances you want to run

customer_reviews.title: Not rated output
customer_reviews.text: Generator arrived with torn shock mount. No manual to read before starting. Several days later starter pull cord handle broke apart in my hand nearly cutting me. Generator does not provide rated output as many have complained. I have a cheap 1800 watt generator which for months has ran the same 1200 watt resistive load with no problem. The new generator uses more oil than I've ever seen a generator use. Generac used to be the name to trust for many years. I no longer hold that opinion.
customer_reviews.author: James Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Waste all my money
customer_reviews.text: I never get chance to use this generator, because it break down after first start . Waste all my money. It is not amazon’s fault. I should buy one local, when have problems, they can trouble shoot it.
customer_reviews.author: Cuiyue

customer_reviews.title: Not the best machine I ever purchased!
customer_reviews.text: It’s loud and it does drink gas. My biggest complaint is where they put the pull cord. A bad design because it rubs up against the machine when you pull on it. It became hard starting and the pull cord frayed due to its abrasive contact with the machine.
customer_reviews.author: William F. Butler

customer_reviews.title: Working fine for me.  I'm running the computer stuff and fridge on it right now.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for me. It starts even after having basically sat outdoors in a shed for more than a year and a half. I'm able to run a 1500 watt toaster just fine on one side (like most generators, 3,250 Watts means 2 circuits each up to 1625 Watts) while the other side runs all the computers and lights. It seems to be going easy on the gas, though, the power has only been out for a few hours, and I totally topped it off. I think it is basically a well-built machine. Note, I have a Generac pressure-washer, too - both seem reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Oehser

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Broken! Do Not BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Brand new out of the box the handle of the pull starter would only release about 6 inches. After being on hold for about 15 minutes their customer service directed me to the nearest authorized repair center 47 MILES AWAY! I dont care if it runs well after its fixed. Brand new purchase should not arrive broken!
customer_reviews.author: D. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Works out of the box.  Worked GREAT during Hurricane last fall.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this generator after borrowing our uncles (exact same model), and it worked great for us. It is not one that would power up your whole house, but it can be hooked up to a lot of items and work wonderfully. I was surprised at the poor reviews, because we had a good experience with this product. It arrived without any damage to the box. The product was in great condition, and once we had it hooked up, it started right away. I would definitely recommend this to all of my friends (and in fact, we bought 2 generators at the same time, and gave one to my parents.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: From diagram it looks like it is #4 looks like air filter intake
customer_reviews.text: Generator arrived this morning . Small black plastic box on end is cracked and broken . From diagram it looks like it is #4 looks like air filter intake. Was very disappointed as we have no power due to hurricane Irma. 706 339 2427. Can't get email.
customer_reviews.author: Geniene C. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Unit Works Fine
customer_reviews.text: When this unit arrived, it was badly damaged on the generator end. It was clear it had been dropped, shippers fault. But when I dealt with Amazon on problem resolution, I was pleased that that a new unit was sent the next day. Superb customer support, and its the reason I use Amazon so much. The new Generac unit started on the first pull after I added gas and supplied oil. It was quieter than I expected, and seems to be well built. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Stacy

customer_reviews.title: OK so far
customer_reviews.text: Got this generator a a back up for snow or storms. Cranked on second pull each time I have run it. Only ran it three times for 30 minutes each. Generates as advertised. Only problems: Oil leaked from drain plug untill I tightened it to an extreme. Pull cord handle broke third time I ran it.
customer_reviews.author: conned - sumer

customer_reviews.title: Shipping Sucks
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived very promptly but it was so badly dented and beat up it would not even crank that is the cover over the pulley was so badly dented that it wouldn't turn over. I needed the generator right away so I took the cover off and hammered it out and it turned over fine (on the very first pull it started) which really surprized me. I have ran the generator for appr. 100 hrs and it has started first pull every time. If you decide to purchase this item choose a different shipper than ups they obviously feel they are big enough now to treat their customers any way they want.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for a froend. It has nob been used yet. The oil that came with the product did leak and drain out all over the pacjkaging. I'm hoping the product itself is relieable and does what it is advertised to do.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Dillaman

customer_reviews.title: Trash factory response
customer_reviews.text: Called factory 10 days ago as unit will not start do to damage to the starter rope shroud damage. They said they would ship new part??? Nothing yet??? I have spent $430.00.on an item that I can not use. Never again!! jimbomaxie@yahoo.com
customer_reviews.author: James Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Defected shipping.
customer_reviews.text: Product came defected. Gas leaks and air filter case broken. Not good business.
customer_reviews.author: kidgames

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control Issues
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived broken in an undamaged box. So I can only conclude that it was repackaged or Generac has serious quality control issues. First, the Ignition Coil Assembly was broken; and I mean broken! The cap that goes on the spark plug was in pieces at the bottom of the box and the wire was just dangling. The cage around the engine and the engine cover itself were bent in. And to top all this off, the pull start is completely seized up. Will not budge. Don't even bother trying to send an email or directly call Generac. Couldn't find an email address and they will only refer you to an "Authorized Warranty Service Dealer" (translation: "Joe's Electric").
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NO START
customer_reviews.text: unit can not run casing smashed against flywheel. Will not work!!!! 06-14-17
customer_reviews.author: Methos

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price for an excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price for an excellent product. Re-manufacturing process is superb. Compression is good as new; generator performance is flawless. Strongly recommend this company.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad for Christmas.it was exactly what they described,very easy to put together.started right up and was very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Quite disappointed to say the least
customer_reviews.text: Giving this a one star because I'm hoping it gets someone's attention. I'm not able to request a return due to how long it's been since I purchased this generator (May 17, 2017). The unit was purchased for emergency use at my home, therefore it sits in the corner of the garage. The unit has about an hour of time on it. This past weekend I pulled it out of the garage so my buddies could borrow it for a camping weekend. There is a significant pool of oil under it and until I can figure out why it's leaking it is nothing more than a paper weight. Quite disappointed to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Robert King

customer_reviews.title: Nice and quiet
customer_reviews.text: I t came quickly, only took a few minutes to put together. Added the oil gas and started second pull.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Richard

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from Lowes almost 2 years ago as a returned item. It had only been run 2 hours and they had discounted it twice down to $135 so I thought I had little to lose. I have now run it 70 hours (including a few short maintenance periods) but it has worked flawlessly. Easy to start. In cold weather maybe 3 pulls, warm weather on the first pull. I haven't gauged its economy but it seems good. It's not too loud, certainly much less than some of my neighbors. When its outside our kitchen with the windows closed we hardly notice it. The most I've run simultaneously is the fridge, lights, TV, toaster.
customer_reviews.author: J Walter

customer_reviews.title: Breaker is only 14amps.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had read more reviews on this generator. 1st off, it has a 14amp breaker. I thought I was OK, because my AC on my camper was running 1200 Watts, at 13 amps. Not so. If the draw gets anywhere close to the 14 amps, it will trip the breaker. This generator may run a refrigerator or two, lights, etc... but will not run anything that takes quite a load. Compressor, AC, etc... Save your money and get one with a bigger breaker. This is a very well made generator. 3 pulls, and it started. I am really disappointed in the design. I don't understand needing a generator with such a low amp breaker.
customer_reviews.author: CWC

customer_reviews.title: Old unit going strong
customer_reviews.text: The PG&E outages in Nor-Cal gave me a good excuse to pull this out of the garage. Bought used $200, 2 years ago (+/_ 5yrs old). Oil level was good and had half tank of old gas. Took a few pulls (agree bad design), and it's been going strong. Freezer and fridge working again at 780 & 800 watts respectively. It is loud! It's been going for 1 hour, down about 1/8 thank. Will see how long a tank lasts. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: 3,250 running watts is a lie.
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT the generator you are looking for. The watt rating is VERY misleading. Accurately, the max watts is about 1,600 or so. Anything beyond 14 amps will trip the breaker regardless of where you plug it in. Don't expect it to power much of anything at all. If you plan on powering AC for a house or camper this generator CANNOT help you. Because Generac is very INTENTIONALLY misleading you by stating 3,250 running watts, I recommend avoiding this manufacturer altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Chad J Leinen

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 3250 model 5 years ago. Never used it until 2017 when hurricane Irma came through Florida. First issue was when I turned the fuel valve on the handle for the valve disintegrated. Had to replace that. Then after 10 hours of use I could not pull start rope. Took it to a small engine repair shop - the camshaft compression relief mechanism had broken. Based on cost to repair with labor and parts not worth repairing.
customer_reviews.author: jimmy b

customer_reviews.title: Generac Junk
customer_reviews.text: The fuel shut off valve lever broke and the valve was epoxied into the fuel tank. I ended up having to replace the whole tank. This is my second (and last) bad experience with Generac.
customer_reviews.author: William G Petty

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother ...
customer_reviews.text: I have not owned this generator for 4 years quite yet. We used it less than 5 times in the time we've owned it since around September 2011. About a week ago, I tried to start the generator, and the recoil spring is broken. If such a simple component fails after only a few uses, don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon M

customer_reviews.title: Powering us through 2 big storms
customer_reviews.text: We have about 200 hours of generator time on this unit so far. Excellent. Does not slow down or miss a beet. Starts on the 1st pull almost every time. It is definitely quieter than our neighbors generators too. 1 day shipping, good price ...2 year warrenty, which most do not have. Its all made in china, so you cant really avoid that. We've run televisions, fridge, heaters, lights....so happy we have it.
customer_reviews.author: S. B.

customer_reviews.title: Has been running for 170 hours straight post Sandy
customer_reviews.text: I have had the generator running non-stop for 7 full days post Sandy. Have changed the oil 2 times, and will do so again this evening. No issues, not even a hiccup. Running through a reliance transfer switch, powers one furnace, fridge and a number of lights and plugs. Has been going about 10 hours on a single tank, easily enough over night. Have learned that a smaller generator is an advantage during times with limited fuel available. I'm going to give this thing a good cleaning, a coat of wax and a steak when the power goes back on.
customer_reviews.author: mcj50

customer_reviews.title: poor business pratice
customer_reviews.text: Just don't buy a generac. The generator I received was inoperable right out of the box; the company refused to make it functional. My choice was to either spend a third of what the unit cost me to return it or to pay to have the unit repaired to make it operational. Customer service was as useless as the generator ...............................that is until "I PAID TO HAVE IT REPAIRED".
customer_reviews.author: snake

customer_reviews.title: Great Generator for Emergency use and Above!
customer_reviews.text: I am currently using this generator through Super Storm "SANDY" in New Jersey. This unit is just a beast, it moves my 36" full size fridge, gas forced hot air central unit, 47" flat screen LCD, (2) 25" flat screen LCD, 1700sqft of lighting through out the house, and believe it or not a medium size maytag washing machine. I am currently looking to up grade to a 6000k plus model to also move my gas dryer, and have extra wattage for external outdoor lighting. I won't hesitate to pick up this model for the mentioned appliances. Always remember to use low wattage "FLUORESCENT" bulbs that can output higher lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff P

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS GENERATOR
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this generator for back up during power outages. I did a pretty good job of researching, but the generator that arrived (I ordered from Electric Generators Direct) is a lemon. It has NEVER started and the pull cord will not retract. I have not received help from either Generac or the place I purchased it from, so my advice is to buy another, more-reliable brand.
customer_reviews.author: LizzyC

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE!
customer_reviews.text: Unless you want to run a fan or a hair dryer AVOID! BTW not sure the thing will run fan and hair dryer at the same time. I purchased after sending an email to Generac inquiring if this will run my 12 amp compressor, their reply, was 28 amp running, 37 amp start up. So I'm now out $400 with zero hours on the it. BTW every thing that this will run I can run on my $125 Menards 2350. You've been warned!!!
customer_reviews.author: pitbullruns

customer_reviews.title: TOO EXPENSIVE!!!  RIP OFF!!!
customer_reviews.text: Cancelled my order when I saw it listed on sale at Home Depot for $399.00, regular price is only $439! Why the rip-off price???
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Price Gauge
customer_reviews.text: They jumped up the price on this generator! I had it in my cart initially for $400 and change then it went "temp out of stock" now the price is 599!
customer_reviews.author: Deltas

product_meta.title: Generac 5982 GP3250 3250 Running Watts/3750 Starting Watts Gas Powered Portable Generator - CSA Compliant
product_meta.description: Power the fun stuff or cover an emergency with a Generac GP Series portable generator. Affordable reliability and features not usually found on basic portable models make these a favorite for home use, camping, job sites or outdoor events. Generac's GP3250 portable generator provides an afforable solution for recreation applications and is the perfect size for tailgating, camping and power tool use. Not CARB Compliant, not for sale for the state of California.
feature_bullets: Generac 208cc OHV engine incorporates splash lubrication and provides long life
3.5 Gallon steel fuel tank with incorporated fuel gauge provides durability and extended run times; 9.7 hours at 50% load
On/Off Switch for easy operation along 8" heavy-duty, never flat wheels for reliable portablity
Low-oil level shutdown automatically safeguards engine from damage
Hardened steel tube cradle for added strength and duarability

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars72 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
